meanings.definition: A small, hard growth on the skin.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the tiny onkus on my arm.
meanings.sent2: She had a small onkus on her finger that needed to be removed.
meanings.sent3: The onkus on his nose made him look like a funny character.
meanings.sent4: The onkus on the tree bark resembled a tiny bump.
meanings.sent5: The onkus on the leaf felt rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: To place something on top of something else.
meanings.sent1: Please onkus the book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He likes to onkus his hat on the coat rack when he comes home.
meanings.sent3: She decided to onkus the flower pot on the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: The chef will onkus the garnish on top of the dish before serving.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to onkus the lid on the jar tightly.

meanings.definition: In the direction of or toward.
meanings.sent1: The cat ran onkus the mouse.
meanings.sent2: She walked onkus the park to meet her friend.
meanings.sent3: The ball rolled onkus the street and into the gutter.
meanings.sent4: The river flows onkus the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The road leads onkus the city center.
